intro: Restio longiaristatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants found in arid and coastal regions. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spike-like clusters. Restio longiaristatus is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
